unit.utterance: lēn qōn̄ ne vōwal kaka din 'a kelgi lusuwēn so lēn 'a lēn mērig
unit.utterance_translation: One day - this story is from the other side over there, from Lēmērig.
unit.add_comments: In the second half of this, the speaker stumbles and restarts a couple of times. He refers to the place where the story is situated, which is the village of Lemerig. This village lies in the other side of a coastal point and the area can be reached only by canoe. It is commonly referrd to by Vera'a speakers as 'the other side', in downwind direction from Vera'a village.

unit.utterance: qōn ne vōwal 'erē 'an̄sar 'a lēmērig
unit.utterance_translation: One day there were the people of Lemerig.
unit.add_comments: The clausal core consists only of the predicative NP, and this type of non-verbal clause expresses existence of the NP's referent.

unit.utterance: vaga dir ga van qel dir ga vovon̄odo lēn me' ne vōwal rōvrōv'en vonore
unit.utterance_translation: All the time they went down [to the sea] and went fishing and collecting shells at one reef close to their home [village].

unit.utterance: lēn masōgi direm vovon̄odo
unit.utterance_translation: When they went fishing and collecting shells,

unit.utterance: dirēk mul kal dirēk bigbig ēn gorēn vovon̄odo sin mes dirēm da sin goto sin wōkalkal sin wōsēs senē
unit.utterance_translation: then they went up home and ate their catch: fish which they prepared, hermit crab, crab or shells; like this.
unit.add_comments: "bigbig" denotes the non-staple component of a usually two-component meal. It translates as "mit" into Bislama (Engl. 'meat') and can be meat, fish, other seafood, vegetables like cabbage or cucumber. Bigbig is usually cooked in coconut cream.

unit.utterance: dirēk mul 'ō kal lēn vonore dirēk big
unit.utterance_translation: They took it up to their village and had it [with sth. else].

unit.utterance: dirēm da senē vagam da vaga da vaga vavan
unit.utterance_translation: They did it like this all the time, did it all the time

unit.utterance: lēn qōn̄ ne vōwal e ruwa vōruō duru mak leg 'i
unit.utterance_translation: when one day there was a couple, the two had just got married,

unit.utterance: rekse duru mak leg 'i
unit.utterance_translation: yes, the two had just got married.
unit.add_comments: The clause is not considered for GRAID glossing as it is a mere repetition of the previous clause (cf. Bickel 2003; Haig & Schnell 2011)

unit.utterance: durum 'ēqel rek lēn me' duruk vovon̄odo
unit.utterance_translation: The two went down to the reef to go fishing.

unit.utterance: lēn masōgi durum vovon̄odo qē' duruk mul kal den
unit.utterance_translation: When the two finished fishing and collecting shells the two left and went up home.

unit.utterance: 'an̄sara ne vōwal wuva dim kalak den ēn m̄ogi gēr lēn 'ēnēs qōn̄ gēr senē
unit.utterance_translation: One person only, he came out of his house, probably in the middle of the night, like this.

unit.utterance: di ne 'ēqel lēn me' rek di ne sin̄ ēn mugin nev lēn lēn m̄ogi
unit.utterance_translation: He went down to the reef, too; he lit a light in his house

unit.utterance: di ne 'ēqel rek 'an me'
unit.utterance_translation: and also went down to the reef.

unit.utterance: dim 'ēqel 'an me' dim sōsōk kelkel 'an me' 'anē van van van
unit.utterance_translation: When he went down to the reef, he started to look around on the reef until

unit.utterance: dim m̄alrow den so n me' dim kalaka
unit.utterance_translation: he was shocked for the reef, it got up.

unit.utterance: 'enei di ne qē'ēg van sir ēn 'ekē ga rōr
unit.utterance_translation: Now it began to move towards a deep spot / towards the dep sea.

unit.utterance: ba di masōgi dim 'ēn sier so me' dim da 'esenē dim m̄alrow den di ne rara
unit.utterance_translation: And he, when he noticed that the reef it was doing thishe was shocked and cried.

unit.utterance: di ga moros rōw lēn naw ba di mas da m̄as
unit.utterance_translation: He wanted to jump into the sea, but he couldn't do so

unit.utterance: managi si dim rōw lēn naw di me 'ul
unit.utterance_translation: because if he jumped into the sea, he would drown.

unit.utterance: so dim 'ukeg wuva diē
unit.utterance_translation: So he just let it do so,

unit.utterance: dim 'ir 'i 'an me' 'anē'ē
unit.utterance_translation: and so he was standing on the reef now.

unit.utterance: lēn masōgi di ne n me' ne vanvan rak lik row lēn 'ekē ga rōr di ne sōk sier son me' dim gis reksen dim van ma reksen 'an̄sara
unit.utterance_translation: While it ... the reef was moving further out (into the sea) towards where it is deep, he found that the reef, it became like a person / human being.

unit.utterance: dim rērē kal reksen 'aval n̄ēn̄ērē' me' dim rērē kal den ēn naw di ne tek mē diē so bul
unit.utterance_translation: It craned its neck upwards like one end of the reef it stretched out of the sea and said to him: "Friend,

unit.utterance: nik van man lēn kolok lēn basbas nagi itok gēduk van tetel
unit.utterance_translation: come onto my back, onto the end of it, then, all right, we two go."
unit.add_comments: Constructional error with the common article inserted after the directional particle 'hither'. A locative PP expressing the goal of the movement follows rather than an object NP -- which would not be licensed by the valency of the VC here anyway.

unit.utterance: so nik m 'enei gēduō va'a lēn venē lama
unit.utterance_translation: "You ... now we are in the middle of the sea."

unit.utterance: itok so gēduk 'ēqel lēn vunuō ne vōwal dir ga ul son Torres lēn suwēn vunuō ne vōwal rak rōw 'ēnē dir ga ul Torres
unit.utterance_translation: All right, then: "We two are going to go to one island which is called Torres. Down there, one island further down(wind) which is called Torres.
unit.add_comments: The locative preposition does not make sense here, and the local adverb 'downwind' occurs on clause level.

unit.utterance: ba nik wom 'ēn son naw wom lōl luwo ma si wom van kal gōr gēduō nike kalraka nike 'ir kal den gōr n naw ne le nike
unit.utterance_translation: But when you see when the sea is getting big and rising to flood us, get up and stand away to save yourself from the sea to take you.

unit.utterance: wo nikm 'ēn n naw dim 'ēqel kel nike sag sur kel
unit.utterance_translation: When you see the sea that it lowers again, sit down again."

unit.utterance: durum da 'eseneē van van van vavavan
unit.utterance_translation: The two did like this on and on.

unit.utterance: ne maran ne qōn̄
unit.utterance_translation: It got day, and it got night.

unit.utterance: ne maran duruk din̄ ēn mē'ērsa
unit.utterance_translation: When it got day, the two reached a harbour.

unit.utterance: durum kal lēn mē'ērsa lēn vunuō ne vōwal dir ga ul so Hiw lēn Torres 'erē vunuō 'arn̄i vunuō 'a suwēn 'a Torres dir ga ul Hiw
unit.utterance_translation: The two came to the shore at a harbour at one island which is called Hiw in the Torres, some islands, a group of islands down at Torres which is called Hiw,

unit.utterance: durum kal ba' 'ekēnē
unit.utterance_translation: the two landed there.

unit.utterance: durum van sar lēn mē'ērsa ne vōwal
unit.utterance_translation: When the two went into a harbour,

unit.utterance: me' ne tek mē die so 'ama' lēn 'an̄sara lēn me' ne tek mē diē so
unit.utterance_translation: reef said to him, the ghost in … the person in the reef said to him:

unit.utterance: bul duk kal ba'a duk momse ke'i 'ekēgēn du me momse 'alēn 'aklē qōn̄ duk mul kel lēn 'ekē gēdum van ma den
unit.utterance_translation: "Friend, we two are going to land and rest for a while here; we will rest here for a few days, and then we go back to where we came from."

unit.utterance: durum kal ba' sar kēne
unit.utterance_translation: The two went inside to the shore at this place,

unit.utterance: va n me' m van sar van sar van sar m van sar lēn lēn qil anē'ē m kal ba' 'enteg sar
unit.utterance_translation: the reef went inside, went inside, and when it had gone into the bay, had gone well inside,

unit.utterance: so no me sag ren̄ kēgēn bak
unit.utterance_translation: it said: "I'll be stuck here, but

unit.utterance: bul nike row kal sar 'an n 'ekē ga mamasa 'anē'ē
unit.utterance_translation: friend, you, jump onto the shore at this dry place here.

unit.utterance: nike van kal lēn n̄ērē'iē
unit.utterance_translation: Go up to the shore,

unit.utterance: nike dar ekēne nike siksik gom ēn gengen rekse sava nik me 'ēn sier m̄as 'alēn nik ga gen nike gen
unit.utterance_translation: and wait there. Search some food for you, like: what you can find in order to eat, eat it.
unit.add_comments: The possessive classifier for EAT possession plus possessor suffix is incorporated into the VC here and expresses a beneficiary.

unit.utterance: nike dar gōr si nom tek mē nikē so duk mul kel duk mulō
unit.utterance_translation: You wait and if I tell you: "We two are gonna go back home." we'll go home.

unit.utterance: nike sōk sier lik ēn 'ōnō mimi'ir nōm nike mi'ir
unit.utterance_translation: Further more, find a place to sleep for you and sleep (there).

unit.utterance: nike on sur nike mi'ir
unit.utterance_translation: Lay down and sleep.

unit.utterance: 'alēn masōgi rekse nom ulul kel nikē lēn sav qōn̄ du wom mulō duk mulō
unit.utterance_translation: All right, when I am calling you again, on some day that we two are going home, we two go home."

unit.utterance: itok duruk van kal di ne van kal row kal sarēn dim 'ōg kelkel 'ōg kelkel n me' ne onon rōw nē'
unit.utterance_translation: All right, the two went landwards ... he jumped up onto the shore, and while he was staying there all the time, staying there all the time, the reef was lying down there.

unit.utterance: dim 'ōg kelkel van van van vavavavan
unit.utterance_translation: He stayed around there on and on,

unit.utterance: dim qōn̄ ne vōwal dim mi'ir lik
unit.utterance_translation: He ... one night when he slept again,

unit.utterance: di ne mi'ir suwō di ne qōrqōr n me' ne van ma ne tēk mē diē so
unit.utterance_translation: he slept deep and was dreaming, the reef came and said to him:

unit.utterance: gōduō me mul kel qiri lēn kalraka duk 'ēqel
unit.utterance_translation: "we two will go back home today at ... get up, let us two go down (off the shore)!

unit.utterance: n 'an̄saram kalraka van 'a'ag diē
unit.utterance_translation: The man got up and followed him,

unit.utterance: rekse dim van 'ag ēn qōrqōr ne 'ēqel din̄ rōwē ne vavan kal ma 'an me' n me' mal dar diē rekse ga di mal sal kal
unit.utterance_translation: i.e. he went following the dream, went down to the sea, went back onto the reef; the reef had already floated upwards;

unit.utterance: n me' mal kalrak den 'onogi a dim on 'i bēne dim sal kal
unit.utterance_translation: the reef had already got up from the place where it had been lying, it floated up there (on the surface).

unit.utterance: 'enei di ga dar diē va'anē so duruk itok rem 'an kolok
unit.utterance_translation: Now it was waiting for him: "All right, climb onto my back."

unit.utterance: dim rem kal 'an kologim row kal kel 'an me' 'anē so ga itok gēduōm van
unit.utterance_translation: He climbed up his back, jumped back up onto the reef: "That's good, we two are going.

unit.utterance: nik me da lik rekse gēdum van ma nik da rekse n naw wom van ma ga lōwōo nike 'ir kal n naw wom 'ēqel nike sag sur
unit.utterance_translation: Do it again like when we two came here: do it like this: when the sea becomes big, stand up; and when the sea lowers, sit down.

unit.utterance: dim row kal rōw 'an kologi duruk 'ēqel va'anē
unit.utterance_translation: He jumped (seawards) onto its back, and then the two went down (i.e. moved away from the shore).

unit.utterance: durum van van da 'esēne van vavavan 'an kele qōn̄ wunvan qōn̄ vōruō duruk din̄ kel ma n mē'ērsa suw 'a ga lēn man̄ri bēne
unit.utterance_translation: They went acting like this until after, I think, two days they reached the harbour again [UNCLEAR]

unit.utterance: duruk kal ba'a kel sarē
unit.utterance_translation: They entered it again.

unit.utterance: ban masōgi durum van ma rōwēn me' di ne mōwōrōo ne vōruō bēne
unit.utterance_translation: But when they came down, the reef broke into two,

unit.utterance: rekse di ne mēlē' kirm̄o' ne vōruō bēne
unit.utterance_translation: i.e. it split into two pieces.

unit.utterance: ge 'ew'i ga lōwōon kum̄ ga lōwōo ne sag 'i rōwē
unit.utterance_translation: The big one, the big reef sat down there,

unit.utterance: wo n menre kum̄ 'ane'ē̄ ne van kel sar ne kal 'ō ba'a kel sar ēn 'an̄sara ē lēn lēn mē'ērsa
unit.utterance_translation: while this piece of the reef moved towards the shore and took this person up the harbour.

unit.utterance: masōgi dim vavavan dim din̄ sar ēn mē'ērsa
unit.utterance_translation: When it moved and arrived inside the harbour,

unit.utterance: di ne tēk mēn me' ne tēk mēn 'an̄sara ē so nike vidir kal va'anē nike van kal 'enei e raga dirēm da gengen sir nikē 'alēn qōn̄ vēlimē sagē
unit.utterance_translation: it said to the reef ... to the man: "Jump upwards now, go upwards. Now everybody up there, they are preparing food for your fifth day.

unit.utterance: 'enei dirēk ... dirēk lik ēk dirēk ... lēn ma'ava 'anei nik row sur 'a 'enei nik virig kal
unit.utterance_translation: Now they ... they take it out ... they ... in the morning you jump down and then run upwards."

unit.utterance: 'enei dirēm da ba nik 'ovi'i rowrow lukei qiri lēn revrev lēn masōgin laklaka nik mak kalu lēn laklaka
unit.utterance_translation: Now they are busy. "But you mustn't come out, yet. Today in the evening, when it's time for the dances, come out to the dances."

unit.utterance: itok dim van sar ne vidir sur won wom̄al ne kal lu kel rōw
unit.utterance_translation: Ok, he went upwards, jumped down, and the reef moved out (into the sea) again.

unit.utterance: masōgi dim van rōw die aqit 'ēn'ēn den ēn vunu luwo Vunu Lava
unit.utterance_translation: When it went out, it was far away from Big Island, Vanua Lava,

unit.utterance: won tō ne tōrtōrōg
unit.utterance_translation: and then the roosters crowed.

unit.utterance: som da 'i so dim dim sag ren̄ 'ekēnē 'enei dir ga ul ēn wōm̄al 'anē'ē kum̄ō 'anē'ē so din Maltetrag
unit.utterance_translation: That made that it got stuck there permanently, and now this reef (w.), (k.) is called 'Maltetrag '.

unit.utterance: sow 'an̄sar dim sag ren̄ 'ekēnē
unit.utterance_translation: So, a person is stuck there.

unit.utterance: 'an̄sara 'anē'ē dim van van kal 'as van sar aq 'i esēnēm (äh) vavan revrev dirēm lik ēn gengen lēn ma'ava dirēm gengen vavanvan rōv'e man revrev dirēk dan laklaka
unit.utterance_translation: That other man, he went straight inland, went upwards bending down, then in the afternoon they took the food out (of the stone oven: S.S.) and in the morning they ate until it almost got afternoon and they did the dances.

unit.utterance: lēn masōgi dim sagsag 'anē ba di ne susur lik ēn aklē dudu woqe 'enge ne da so reksen nōgin ne sigil di bēne
unit.utterance_translation: When he was sitting around, he also sewed some leaves of a tree making up his (clothing S.S.) to decorate himself with (in the appropriate customary way S.S.).

unit.utterance: masōgi dirēm dan laklaka lēn rōrōv'en revrev
unit.utterance_translation: When they did the dances when it was almost afternoon,

unit.utterance: di ne kalu va'anē direm es rak sag ēn laklaka n laklaka rekse wunvan resdōn̄ar [?] n REDUP-dance mu 'ama'
unit.utterance_translation: he came out. They started up the dancing, the 'Nangae leaves brooming' dance, a devil dance.

unit.utterance: masōgi direm direm qē'ēg 'alēn ga laka
unit.utterance_translation: When they started to dance,

unit.utterance: di ne lak lu ma rek va'anē
unit.utterance_translation: he danced out as well.

unit.utterance: dim laka rekse dim lak luma lēn 'ow'ow lēn m̄oa laklaka dim lak lu ma
unit.utterance_translation: He danced, i.e. he came out dancing before, at the first dance he came out dancing.

unit.utterance: m da so vagruō nagi dire 'ēn rak 'ēn diē
unit.utterance_translation: The second time they didn't recognize him, yet.

unit.utterance: da vag'ōl nagi dire 'ēn rak 'ēn diē
unit.utterance_translation: The third they didn't recognize him, yet.

unit.utterance: 'enei direk dōm so direk gis vagra diē va'anē son sav nē n 'ama' sin 'an̄sara
unit.utterance_translation: Now they start to think about holding him tight (to find out, S.S.): what is it then, a ghost or a (living, S.S.) human.

unit.utterance: so direm dada 'eno 'alēn ga gis vavarga die lēn vag'ōl nagi a dim lak luma direk gis varga
unit.utterance_translation: So they tried to hold him tight, and the third time he danced out, they held him tight.

unit.utterance: masōgi direm gis varga die direk sōk sier so 'o din 'an̄sara direm ran̄ den n nogin 'erē wōsisigile
unit.utterance_translation: When they held him tight they found out: "Oh, he is a human being." and pulled off his ritual decorations.

unit.utterance: direk sōk sier so 'o din 'an̄sara
unit.utterance_translation: They found out: "oh, he is a human being."

unit.utterance: 'o ba e ge 'anē'ē sa dirs dan gengen sir qiri 'anē
unit.utterance_translation: "Oh, but he is the one they prepared the meal for tonight."

unit.utterance: itok e direk vesir die di ne kaka mē diren 'erē kaka rekse sivie dim van sivie dim 'ēqel suw lēn Torres
unit.utterance_translation: Ok, then they were asking him, and he told them all the stories, like how he went, how he went down to the Torres,

unit.utterance: dim 'og'og suwei
unit.utterance_translation: - when he was down there -

unit.utterance: dim es sivie wo sivie dim kel ma m din̄ rekse
unit.utterance_translation: how he lived and how he returned hither, and it lasted until … like

unit.utterance: dirēm dimdim kel ēn kele qōn̄ vēlimē
unit.utterance_translation: they reached another fifth day after that.

unit.utterance: so dirēm dan qōn̄ vēlimē mugi
unit.utterance_translation: Then they celebrated his fifth day.

unit.utterance: dim din̄ kel ma mēn 'eraga sōsōgōgi 'eraga nini'igi lēn vunuō 'a Lēnmerig
unit.utterance_translation: He had come back to everybody of his line, his descendents at the village of Lemerig.

unit.utterance: Wunvan kaka dim qē' 'ekēnē
unit.utterance_translation: I think the story is over here.
